mdRecord.dcterms:title: X-ray tube with protective housing
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: General Electric Company
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Coolidge X-ray tube and protective housing with interchangeable air and water cooling system. Four pieces include: x-ray tube, radiator device for air cooling, round assembly for water cooling, and end cap. Engraving: "Victor Made in U.S.A. Coolidge Tube." This item was given in honor of Theodore E. Keats, M.D., F.A.C.R., Chair of the UVa Department of Radiology from 1963-1991.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medical instruments or apparatus
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: University of Virginia Medical Artifacts Collection
